title: Rhetoric
author: Aristotle
key_ideas: Rhetoric is the art of persuasion through three modes: ethos, pathos, and logos.
Ethos establishes the speaker's credibility and character.
Pathos appeals to the audience's emotions.
Logos uses logical reasoning and evidence.
Effective rhetoric combines all three modes appropriately.
Understanding rhetoric helps both in persuasion and in recognizing manipulation.

micro_lessons.title: The Three Modes
micro_lessons.core_idea: Ethos (credibility), Pathos (emotion), Logos (logic) are the three pillars of persuasion.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What are the three modes of persuasion?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Ethos establishes credibility, Pathos appeals to emotion, and Logos uses logical reasoning.

micro_lessons.title: Appropriate Use
micro_lessons.core_idea: Different situations require different emphasis on each mode. Match your approach to context.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: When should you emphasize pathos over logos?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: When the audience needs emotional connection or when values and feelings are central to the issue.
